channel.title: Possessor needs a buff
channel.description:
Right now Possessor seems like the strongest NK. However this is no actually the case as he has the lowest winrate by far even compared to other NK's
That's a 7% winrate by the way.
I propose 2 changes:
Change 1:
> Day Ability 2: Name needed - Puppet strings will bypass night immunity tonight. (Optional: The person controlled will be notified of the possession when this is in effect). (2 uses)
Change 2:
Just make Possess bypass heal.

Overall this looks good. DA1 allows it to easily claim Noble while also minimizing their auto-confirmation and can also help during lategame while DA2 also helps it against guarded targets.

item.title: Possessor needs a buff
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Possessor

Neutral Killer

Passive 1: Driven - Occupy and redirect immune
Passive 2: Black shield - Death immune

Day ability 1: Manipulate - Force target player to accuse someone and prevent further voting. (2 uses)
Day Ability 2: Dominate - Puppet Strings will bypass night immunity tonight. (2 uses)

Night Ability 1: Puppet Strings - Force target player to attack someone. (Unlimited)
Night Ability 2: Possess - Kill target player and take their body bypassing Healing. You will heal them from other attacks and statuses before taking their body. You choose what class your body will flip as. (2 uses)

Read full topic

item.title: Possessor needs a buff
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Alice:

For a secondary effect, it should also cause the target to vote with the Possessor provided the Poss doesn’t abstain.

This would actually suck. If you have a noble claim and you use this Ability there is one of 3 situations:

1: They are not put up to the stand - Here it doesn’t matter what happens on the stand because they aren’t voting anyway.

2: They are put up and it is BD majority. - Here it just outs you. If it was a noble they would abstain. Therefor when they don’t it makes it obvious that you are a Possessor.

3: They are put up and you have majority this way - Here it also doesn’t matter regardless. The only time this can happen is in a 1 v 2 where once the person it is on the stand only you need to exe to get them lynched.

Read full topic

item.title: Possessor needs a buff
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
So… another option could be give the possessor Noble’s force vote? Hmmm…

I can get behind this. This should also stop the “force a vote if you’re Noble” test as Noble is so far a pretty good claim for poss provided they don’t ask for the voting ability. For a secondary effect, it should also cause the target to vote with the Possessor provided the Poss doesn’t abstain.

Read full topic

item.title: Possessor needs a buff
item.dc:creator: UncannyLuck
item.description:
Of those, only Party is guaranteed to save the target 100% of the time. Knights don’t always spawn, prevention isn’t readily available (or in the case of Starting King - not at all available) and Tornado can’t be used on the King (who is the usual target of empower reaps and the one you’d want to protect).

Reaper has chill to deal with the last few on the final days. Sorc has voting power in the Unseen. So… another option could be give the possessor Noble’s force vote? Hmmm…

Read full topic

item.title: Possessor needs a buff
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
UncannyLuck:

Also there’s not really counter play to Empower Reap

Knight, Prevention, Tornado, Party.

Armored does let knight survive. Empower does not interact with the passive

UncannyLuck:

or Enforcer Frenzy

True. But I consider this a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Possessor needs a buff
item.dc:creator: UncannyLuck
item.description:
Firelitten:

Enforcer can be countered by a butler Serve wine

UncannyLuck:

(that isn’t reliant on you knowing who the assassin/enforcer/reaper is)

If you know who they are, you jail them as Prince and exe them. And it works for even Possess.

But if that’s the argument - just happy hour them.

Read full topic
